result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody L. Heiman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with case #13CF397
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $100 to Carol Machkovich
--to pay the $10 restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or ingestion of alcohol; no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing, at least twice per month for the first year
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and for incidental contact at work or school as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court. 

 If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

cases #13CF397 & #14CF39 called at 1:47pm. 
Defendant Jody L. Heiman in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Shock submits the victim impact statement; Ms. Mackovich makes a brief statement); the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Heiman guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Ms. Heiman to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with case #13CF397.

The Court finds that Ms. Heiman is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Heiman is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or ingestion of alcohol; no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing, at least twice per month for the first year
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and for incidental contact at work or school as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $100 to Carol Machkovich
--to pay the $10 restitution processing fee
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
The Court will not consider expungement of this case. 
recess 2:10pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 3, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Scheduling Notice

cases #13CF397 and #14CF39 called at 9:38am. 
Defendant Jody L. Heiman in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #14CF39:
Ms. Heiman waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 9:42am. 
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record Ms. Heiman indicates that she is moving today to a new address in Waunakee; this address is provided to the clerk.]

cases #13CF397 & #14CF39  called at 11:46am. 
Defendant Jody L. Heiman in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek requests the scheduling of a Pretrial Conference. 
When the Court inquires of Ms. Heiman whether the Spry Street address is current, Kenneth Heiman, who is present in the courtroom interjects that he does not want Ms. Heiman at the Spry Street address her there.  Kenneth Heiman begins to discuss the basis for this request.  However then Attorney Svehlek indicates that Ms. Heiman is now indicating that she will move yet this afternoon to her cousin's address:  c/o Adrian Gonzalez  107 Newcomb Street, Whitewater, WI 53190.

The Court modifies the bond in #14CF39 to add the condition of:  effective at midnight on January 31, 2014,  not to be present at 214 Spry Avenue in Fort Atkinson. 
recess 11:53am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/5/14 at 11:20am.  (2) schedule case #14CF39 for Preliminary Hearing and case #13CF397 for Status Conference on same date/time in late February

case called at 1:29pm. 
Defendant Jody L. Heiman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no discussion of the facts Carol Mackovich, Kenneth Heiman, or Rebecca Reed
recess 1:36pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference to be scheduled on 1/28/14 at 11:30am. (when Ms. Heiman has another case already scheduled)
